F222700942E944AB857FECD8AF115C0F.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

91265A4454294AC18C33E5FC753734A6.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

F88362DF8DD640979A7459AE300F876A.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

962D73A1CA474170AAFEB19A18249908.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

C7CB0BE512F748DC9208AAFE064E4B47.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry

0DC74C72A1A147639B5566DA314E0DAE.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

8ADF57D64C1540AEB8E12EC8F8DCBA8D.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

34CC3491329540078DF9574BABD5189C.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

A34C5F4E21834281A3691A663AB86422.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

5BBDEF2D7DAA4566890382E70F506801.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

3814EB1D256745A5AD440D64C1F76A9C.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

86F79F5407C04FF59385DA71CC496330.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

DBCC760688C049E0AEB1207A0B1D3504.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions

42AE9C8C7D4B46C99C1CF76D53E831E3.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours? Who is my supervisor? What should I wear? When will I be provided with safety training? What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement? Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance? What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

3740F1ABEA8E4409BC6F9F5FC234FCBF.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

535E912E818D430297D3BF64F530BE9D.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

DD95FA6D1D954ADBB28F921B1A08AB15.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

E883075D92DD41B5BB7F869D4B9BB9CA.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations

D882A49381D14237902AB47C78E526AD.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

88F3783A58A64BC4AD9E3500D949A8DA.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

20C9FACC383B4470A22728316CD1E681.description: Explain how precision technology is used to enhance or improve livestock production such as radio frequency identification, biometric sensors and animal management.

79CABC4351514538B577B9DBC4FCB2E9.description: Investigate how aerial and/or satellite imagery is used in managing pasture vegetation and the security and surveillance of livestock and property.

26487AF0C10D4F858E2EF28723EA6D4F.description: Explore the impact of machine learning on the precision of livestock equipment.

E4FF13328B184BCEBFE285D9BF3C2348.description: Discuss how precision agriculture technologies impact gathering, storing and interpreting livestock records and data.

94489E4674EB47A78EAC17D65CC9CF16.description: Investigate the benefits and application of precision technology in livestock production.

D3825E6987F54D5A9D763D4871E92BDD.description: Precision Agriculture – Benefits and Application for Livestock (Optional)

D19B31373E6F440FBB76F064ADBAB41E.description: Describe the health and safety hazards to workers and the public of common fertilizer chemicals.

5ECF3AA967A84A0C9C69169265A1887F.description: Investigate how fertilizer application may cause issues with water sources like creeks and ponds.

1EA3932E43E74113A072E52899CE2EB2.description: Analyze the risks (e.g., excess accumulation in water sources and plant health) associated with the application of fertilizers.

0A6B2B2F0EA942BC856AE04EA174DCDE.description: Examine advantages and disadvantages of technologies (e.g., mid-row banders, spreaders, fertigation and variable rate application) used for different application methods for fertilizer.

0739B094F2824D588AA789E76842C871.description: Explain the numbering method (i.e., nitrogen, phosphorus and potassium [NPK] values) used for fertilizers.

C3C2EE14158F49B384D3DDA308ACCAFA.description: Explore the four components of the 4R fertility program.

E56B375E6E3D4A8DA40817683A85E573.description: Describe the types of fertilizer (e.g., granular, liquid, foliar and anhydrous).

5708CE30D90444459F13AF29B7CF5A45.description: Explore how a nutrient application plan is developed.

46216983CB23401FA1DE9683AC76CD18.description: Explain how to interpret a soil test

372E6FD6BB5243649BE541C1CFDF9BA7.description: Demonstrate soil-sampling procedures for developing an appropriate nutrient application plan.

6B38E069415C4569A5CE12FE9D735BD1.description: Explain how macro and micronutrients in soil affect plant growth.

9E55466402AB4673ACBAEE84D9749780.description: Identify the macronutrients (e.g., phosphorus, potassium and nitrogen) and micronutrients (e.g., calcium, zinc and boron) found in soil.

FD6A2263F7E843E7A7665B95CE5E06F4.description: Explore sources of information and on crop health research (e.g., Ministry of Agriculture and agronomists).

F9D723AC670649EAB2042EEE9DB00555.description: Investigate the use of fertilizers in crop production.

EF1D1D11729841959B04ABA7173F027E.description: Compare the advantages and disadvantages of natural and synthetic organic pesticides.

A06EEB396A894A4FA8867EDCC3A8B379.description: Explore organic weed management strategies (e.g., tillage, flame weeding, hand weeding, mulching and seeding date manipulation).

B63B3DF1732E409280E5E951B0D6DFEE.description: Identify approved organic pest management substances (e.g., dormant oils, pheromone traps and soap).

5E88584F1FAB4BFA9BF58F6C329075F9.description: Analyze the importance of buffer zones in organic farming

9E494C4DD26F4E35A7B9F4843DA865FD.description: Explain the effectiveness of organic crop production practices, such as: crop rotation; biodiversity protection; organic matter (e.g., compost and green manure) added to soil; and, use of cover, green manure or under-sow crops used as companion plants, fertilizer or other symbiotic support.

349B734AE51947579FF95CB6E8013D96.description: Explore the management of crops, pests and weeds in organic crop production.

C1922E7C7BE24D668BA25203D64FFE06.description: Organic Crop Production – Crops, Pests and Weeds (Optional)

440DE43179134CCA9499C8108AEF0A35.description: Collect and organize information into a chart, graph, list or table.

37C9C3AEBDD343F8BAFAA05DE1F5A04F.description: Determine possible data to record for a crop operation in the following categories: seasonal activities (e.g., seeding dates, spraying quantities and harvesting yield); equipment maintenance; crop management (e.g., crop varieties, yield, fertility levels, weather tracking, field inspections, crop rotation, disease and insect issues and their treatment); financial management (e.g., inventory, storage, bin checks, prices, markets, sales, purchases and shipments); and, risk management (e.g., crop insurance and claim history for each crop and field).

A09AFD7A07EC40518C5A301624333E76.description: Crop Record Keeping – Data Collection and Organization (Optional)

F87F8FF5C7E543838D552058341013F9.description: Discuss the finances of a crop operation including seasonal and foreign workers, buying or leasing equipment, accessibility to markets, cost of input, crop insurance, cash advance programs, risk management tools such as crop insurance and AgStability and expected revenue.

F55936AD30734D5FAA246445C4762025.description: Explain which fertilizers and chemicals are used for specific crops in an operation and the impact that those choices can have on future cropping decisions (e.g., herbicide carryover and what environmental conditions can affect this).

B5FD3E3C57EC489B9606DDF81060C9DF.description: Explore the planting and harvesting methods used for different species of crop.

0A15780326F54788A77A475F9BC61743.description: Analyze existing farm soil types and land features to determine the suitability of the types of crops grown.

9F27604676D143C8B178E4FDB262BFE8.description: Identify the buildings and equipment used for a specific crop production operation.

BAB9C247917448B3A9F015F4409EA42E.description: Describe the farming cycle (e.g., seeding, protection and nutrition, harvesting and preparation for next season) in crop production.

ED70AE7D8FA848D5890F3731985DED99.description: Examine the structure and organization of farm and land management plans for crop production.

6407CF09513543EEB040A1BDCE8AFC23.description: Investigate Canada’s trade agreements with respect to livestock and crop commodities being traded, their impact on producers and supply management and types (e.g., free trade and tariffs) of trade agreements with various countries.

8F4950B2926C4D2F9142B891C97CF0B9.description: Research sources of livestock and crop market information (e.g., marketing specialists, business centres, internet and publications) for various commodities, products and services.

EF052922F1AB461CB84E2D27378A4A27.description: Review market terminology such as futures market, bull market, open market, Freight on Board (FOB) pricing, basis, forward contracting, Act of God clauses, and the difference between wholesale commodity marketing and Farmgate or value-added.

3EB98B6DF1814CFEBA1749090445328B.description: Identify how farmers and ranchers can reduce pricing risk through forward contracts, futures markets or hedging.

7C0E68093051416FB9756C41A2430927.description: Analyze the factors that influence marketing such as product supply and demand, food safety, imports and exports, consumer trends, societal changes and economic conditions.

4A4F73FF9D55431D9C319F170186A8BF.description: Identify the top livestock and crop commodities based on current market values in Saskatchewan and Canada.

6DA0812C49E648828EC824895CE0F497.description: Trace the impact of the multiplier effect on an agricultural product (e.g., food product or meat) from the selling price by the producer to the selling price for the consumer.

6B38FFA20019491ABC94775F09AF7E7B.description: Research agricultural products and/or services produced in Saskatchewan for both domestic and international markets

E1F3278BBCA04ABCAE7D20F6829E0C80.description: Differentiate between domestic and international (e.g., export or trade) markets.

A9237E1FA1374B21944604FD2DC7BD3A.description: Examine the processes involved in marketing livestock and field crop products.

03C8789223ED466D8B92984B274E4384.description: Design a multi-use facility using at least one crop and one livestock breed.

D70250FB388744DEBA60EF4CC780EE08.description: Describe the common components in a multi-use (e.g., grain and different livestock together) production facility.

A68410B1C469403D87D5247DA84756F2.description: Compare the design of crop and livestock facilities.

1703DCE02EBB4F98B339BA0294397CED.description: Create a design for a multi-use facility.

D8483F2281A64669A0160016E9C4795D.description: Identify health and safety hazards and control measures to mitigate them when cleaning or maintaining crop storage facilities.

8BD8C5205F8B4AEDA2C4E0092CD7774B.description: Apply basic repair and maintenance skills to buildings, vegetation and roads.

8BFB37B4AD334AC4B547B8FFBA470A40.description: Identify insects and rodents that can damage grain that isn't properly cleaned and stored.

19A83BC61CF04EEEB5D343E1E84591AF.description: Describe the precautions needed for temporary grain storage (e.g., bags and grain piles on the ground).

CEF478F76B0D45759821D64560306167.description: Explore the necessity of properly cleaning a storage bin when changing the grain it contains.

7B62603E1E7448B39CBDA38F4287E704.description: Investigate the importance of using safe storage charts for specific types of crops.

A81D67A513404EF89242132360C4A949.description: Differentiate between natural air drying, aeration and grain drying and under what circumstances you would use each method.

DC5F6C770033457C9915FC663FDDE4D1.description: Describe the equipment and operating principles of drying and cooling grain.

D7D941B7DBE14D7598F33E332DCD25D3.description: Describe characteristics of grain and crop storage (e.g., protection from moisture, vegetation control and temperature control).

F97F445DFEE74070A1FCA0C53F1AB365.description: Explore the use and maintenance of crop production facilities.

4637F9F47C7E482AA7FF495A82BAC467.description: Discuss ways farmers manage organic matter in the soil.

23E2DC1BF2AD4BF48C47E30326FA983B.description: Explore the causes, effects and management soil salinity.

3CC3126FE28F47FD8C0502E86A4140FB.description: Explain the process of cation exchange in soil.

6F0BCA0005B646F7B518E3C5F76A448C.description: Identify the factors affecting and the proper management of soil pH.

DCD26FD52F61450582653606F544BF01.description: Explore the stages of the nitrogen cycle.

4D5071686E1C43C18DDD2ECD5E27ABA3.description: Describe the main role of fungi in soil health.

4DA34D27DF4E4D05AED6F45DA8C67D2C.description: Investigate the essential and non-essential nutrients used by plants that are found in soil.

CA116CA10FD3462F9A4F84EA78867661.description: Explain the role of the five types of soil microbes.

4A83E6D31FF54746A27BA1B249BE3E8D.description: Explore the nutrient cycles and management of soil.

D3E80062197F497E939427533493BDE2.description: Research sources of support (e.g., websites, telehealth and community centers) for producers experiencing poor psychological health including trauma.

4BBD01A9F13641AFA291C46BE923AAD0.description: Explore practical strategies when poor psychological health prevents an individual from accomplishing farm tasks.

B49E878570464A9E8F5C80764D8CA551.description: Discuss the benefits of monitoring and maintaining positive psychological health.

0502D720E8664531947F216EEE534959.description: Describe unavoidable stresses (e.g., harvest time, calving season, weather events and relationship challenges) in agriculture production.

4AE26C46AB2742F88AE287946EC50847.description: Research how personal financial stress may impact productivity.

1EF4AF0A20534185926BD0B7854A8064.description: Explore the prevalence of mental illness in agricultural producers in Canada

CB5320FB9E62408798CED9D4F9FBC2EA.description: Describe how life/work balance can impact personal wellness.

A7DAD0A4D85C4CF7AFF208A69A48A8D7.description: Investigate personal psychological health and safety in the workplace.

95FFED9EA54D437ABE5EC18785B264FF.description: Practise the methods used to remove and dispose of chemical residue (e.g., fertilizer and pesticide spray) from application equipment.

B92279C02CCE47D086CE93EBEA03EA6B.description: Explore the environmental impacts of unsafe chemical waste disposal, and how that impacts Indigenous communities (e.g., water, animals and traditional medicinal plants).

6236C7E338954DD98784050F76A8271E.description: Investigate the responsibilities and correct environmental handling, cleanup and waste disposal of cleaners, containers, coolants, filters, fuel and lubricants (e.g., grease and oil) including organizations that specialize in their cleanup

BEC5F34771CA4F3391C4CBC9E9FB486B.description: Investigate regulations and responsibilities to safely dispose of leftover chemical and chemical containers.

065FCCCA973443FA9730B3CFEFC77ADC.description: Discuss first-aid procedures for exposure to agricultural chemicals (e.g., fertilizer, pesticide, fuel and anhydrous ammonia).

A8A7F082B34540F7A34EA72267E28467.description: Develop procedures for handling mishaps such as chemical spills.

F51DB5C2FFCD4A90BCE7B787F507F795.description: Practise the safe storage of chemical products.

27026DCD2DFF4897A4CEE9C16DCBCE93.description: Demonstrate safe handling of chemical products using approved safety gear.

BD75F0AAA44D440A96A7066BC5C3643A.description: Explain the uses of agricultural chemicals that would require a Saskatchewan Pesticide Applicator Licence.

D99BAA2753D74CB4906125A4D1F34E31.description: Explore training and certification opportunities (e.g., WHMIS and pesticide applicator licence) on the safe use of agricultural chemicals.

D839DF85DD9D4C5AA8DFE226A2ADA2F0.description: Investigate record keeping strategies for maintaining SDS information.

5BD10CBBC70B440C90E46F1C88685792.description: Describe the potential heath risks of exposure to chemicals.

C0BD646FCC5A473A9553E5AE35001880.description: Identify the types of hazardous materials that an agricultural operation might create.

9BB50863A403407AA162FFA6AC4CFDE0.description: Discuss the purpose and intended use of the mandatory information on a pesticide label as regulated by Health Canada.

9706FCC75E9B43F181A6399F220D915C.description: Demonstrate the different hazards, identifiers and uses of consumer products, control products, and pesticides.

3FB99F82E32E48D99793A105CF23D522.description: Describe the four parts of Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) (i.e., labels with warning symbols, hazard identification and product classification, Safety Data Sheets (SDS), worker education and worksite specific training).

13877ADD01934D36BF082F86D0BF3CA4.description: Identify important information categories from product labels, Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) and manufacturer’s chemical information packages such as compatibility, storage requirements, application method, preharvest intervals and withdrawal periods.

6F929B70A08A4F55AE15FDFD74EA0C30.description: Demonstrate the importance of, and methods used for, maintenance of a clean and safe workplace.

57FBC3334297440A857371B33CFD2702.description: Apply proper handling of hazardous materials to prevent injury in the workplace.

A53B983292414BBEB6F2413C5E6362CF.description: Describe potential business costs of safety or injury incidents (e.g., equipment damage, property damage, down time, insurance premiums, direct healthcare costs, client reputation and pain/suffering).

012B10E7292946D3AB7EC13883BEAFAF.description: Describe the financial penalties for failure to comply with the Occupational Health and Safety Regulations.

683AD8092D1C452D9845DF2F4EBEFC26.description: Describe the use of Hazard Identification, Risk Assessment and the Hierarchy of Controls for Risk Mitigation in Agricultural Production.

C224FA87F16C4911BA014388AB8B6BA4.description: Identify the benefits to employers and employees of the Saskatchewan Workers Compensation Act and the Meredith Principles.

C6AE0579591F491D89DDDEA4E77B3515.description: Describe when coverage from the Saskatchewan Workers’ Compensation Board (WCB) is optional and when it is mandatory.

B71DE19D61BE45598B01BC8F2C2F5245.description: Develop an emergency farm safety plan that includes types of anticipated emergencies and covers communication requirements (e.g., radio, mobile phone, satellite phone), training requirements, directions to location, required equipment and anticipated response times of outside aid.

07B13BB21309471E996476AC614FF4AD.description: Identify the manufacturer’s requirements for the maintenance and storage of personal protective equipment.

BAB2AF6682B4413186690E9ED0CB7EA1.description: Identify the manufacturer’s recommended uses and limitations for common classifications of personal protective equipment including respiratory, hearing, hand, eye and foot protection.

5788DD68628D45E4BCF07971B410F3DB.description: Describe the benefits of agricultural workers obtaining emergency training including First Aid and fire extinguisher use.

231145BFB3E14588BBE9CA0F95F37DAE.description: Identify safe and unsafe practices in using typical agricultural tools (e.g., hand tools, power tools, lifts and winches).

24C0389A0C7548F180AB163A31FE5444.description: Identify the types of and reasons why manufacturers include protective devices (guards) on agricultural equipment.

1F06DEB6006D4702BD437F40C6A28B76.description: Analyze principles and techniques for injury prevention to ensure safety in agriculture production.
